title: Europe relied on Turkey to solve its migrant problem. Now a political fight threatens to revive a crisis.
description: The E.U. is reinforcing its borders, while Turkey accuses Europe of violating its values.
content:
Our first priority is making sure that order is maintained at the Greek external border, which is also a European border, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said in Greece on Tuesday, thanking the country for being Europes shield.

author: Greg Sargent
title: Bernie Sanders faces his biggest test yet
description: A loss in Michigan would be particularly painful to the Vermont Senator.
content:
And Michigans outcome will hold special significance for Sanders. Indeed, some Democratic pollsters believe that if Biden can defeat Sanders there, it might effectively end Sanders campaign.
To understand why this is, you need to go back to 2016, when Sander… [+3781 chars]

author: Philip Bump
title: Where Sanders’s support eroded in Virginia and North Carolina
description: Sanders won fewer precincts than he did in 2016, with Biden winning a more geographically diverse victory than Clinton.
content:
Former vice president Joe Biden currently leads Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) by 30 points.
It wasnt just Virginia. The contest in North Carolina, when Bidens lead is a more modest 19 points, was also called quickly. In both states, as with so many of the cont… [+2474 chars]

author: Ian Livingston
title: PM Update: Turning somewhat cooler through Thursday
description: Temperatures drop — to closer to normal.
content: It was our third day in a row with highs in the mid-60s, which is certainly boosting that springtime feel across the region. Although we will take a bit of a step backward tomorrow as far as temperatures go, the cool-down will only be closer to normal for the… [+1136 chars]

author: Erin Cunningham, Dalton Bennett
title: Coronavirus pummels Iran leadership as data show spread is far worse than reported
description: Information obtained from Tehran hospitals suggests that the outbreak is dramatically larger than the government says.
content:
With the outbreak in Iran representing one of the largest in the world, Kianoush Jahanpour, a spokesman for the health ministry, said Wednesday the virus has killed 92 people across the country with nearly 3,000 people known to have been infected.
